cards.rules_text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase. During that combat phase, you can't attack players.

As a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may exile a card from your hand. If you do, that land enters the battlefield with a cadaver counter on it.
Whenever you tap a land with a cadaver counter on it for mana, add one mana of any color.

When The Amber Cage enters the battlefield, exile target nonland permanent an opponent controls.
{T}: Add one mana of any of the exiled card's colors.

If a permanent an opponent controls would phase in, it phases in tapped with a stun counter on it instead.
[+1]: Draw a card, then discard a card. If you discarded a nonland card this way, gain 3 life.
[0]: Target nonland permanent phases out.
[-6]: For each opponent, choose land or nonland. All permanents of the chosen type that player controls phase out.

When Brave the Gold Road enters the battlefield or whenever a defense counter is removed from it, create a Treasure token. [i](It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this token: Add one mana of any color.”)[/i]

cards.notes:
Green uncommon creature percentage have gone up slightly from 62% (8 out of 13) to 64% (9 out of 14), making it the only color, along with white, to go up in percentage.

...

Play Boosters have added 20 cards to uncommon. By default, five went to monocolor, ten to multicolor, and five to colorless, most often artifacts or lands. The uncommon creatures, like those at common, want to be generically useful. This is often where we'll put cards that have synergy with large set themes, allowing all colors access to it.

{W}{U} TIMESTREAM Take early advantage of enters the battlefield triggers and control the board before your creatures phase in.
{U}{B} COUNTERS Battles and Armies allow you to rely on counter manipulation for victory.
{B}{R} OUTFLANK Split your attacks tactically between battles and opponents to outflank your foes.
{R}{G} BATTLES Attack aggressively across many fronts, while Conflicts offer you additional potency.
{G}{W} AMASS Build an army big enough to conquer Jamuraa.
{W}{B} OUTFLANK Outmatch your foes with evasive attackers and reap the benefits.
{B}{G} BATTLES You can outlast all of Jamuraa as you battle across varied Conflicts.
{G}{U} TIMESTREAM Ramp to expensive spells, or cast them early with Teferi's timestream magic.
{U}{R} NONCREATURE SPELLS Battles, artifacts, and enchantments all contribute to the Mirage War.
{R}{W} OUTFLANK Strike quickly and pressure your opponent with early aggression, your outflank triggers aiding the effort.
Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may pay {2}. If you do, draw a card.
